name: Ultimate Jersey Ripper
author: Matt R
summary: A ripper is a local Jersey term for hot dogs that are deep-fried. The term is used to describe the ripping of the hot dog skin when bathed in hot oil. Add bacon, corn chips, and onions in sauce and you've got yourself the Ultimate Jersey Ripper.
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) jar pushcart-style onions in sauce
directions: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Wrap each hot dog with a slice of bacon, securing ends with toothpicks
Fry hot dogs 2 at a time in hot oil until they float to the surface, 3 to 4 minutes
Pour onions into a small pot over low heat
Stir until heated through, about 5 minutes
Arrange fried hot dogs in rolls
Garnish with onions and crushed corn chips
